_header: In women is rest peace and patience
Note: Cf. 406; may possibly be the second stanza of 3804.
_description: On Women, two views depending on the punctuation adopted — one 8-line stanza

CULHh26.First Lines:
In women is rest peas and pacienceNo season for soth outht of
                    charite…
CULHh26.Last Lines:
…In theym may ye neuer fynd y gesse CruelteSuche condicions
                    they haue more & lesse
CULHh26.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “Punctuation Poems—A Further Note.” 
             Review of English Studies
         15 (1939): 206-7: 206.
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.

Stevens,  John,
                        ed.  
             Music and Poetry in the Early Tudor Court.
         London: Methuen, 1961: 162.
